meanings.definition: Relating to, or resembling a basilica.
meanings.sent1: The basilical architecture of the church was grand and impressive.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a basilical dome on the ceiling of the museum.
meanings.sent3: The basilical columns in the garden looked like ancient pillars from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a basilical quality, filling the room with warmth and resonance.
meanings.sent5: The basilical design of the building made it stand out among the modern structures.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or situated at the base of something.
meanings.sent1: The basilical layer of soil provided a strong foundation for the plants.
meanings.sent2: The basilical support beam held up the entire structure.
meanings.sent3: The basilical roots of the tree spread out wide and deep into the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a basilical rock, unshakable and solid.
meanings.sent5: The basilical level of the building was essential for stability during earthquakes.
